author: @indiatoday
title: Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors
text:
Fasting farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health condition critical, say doctors
Doctors said that the health condition of Dallewal, is on a hunger strike since November 26, is deteriorating and his "life is hanging by a threat". They said that the farm leader is at the risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure as well.
In Short
- Farm leader Jagit Singh Dallewal is on a 24-day hunger strike
- Dallewal's health is critical with risk of cardiac arrest
- Doctors urge hospitalisation for Dallewal's deteriorating condition
Farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on a hunger strike at Khanauri border for 24 days, became unconscious for around 10 minutes on Thursday after his blood pressure dropped.
Doctors said that the health condition of Dallewal, who is a farm leader from Punjab, is deteriorating and his "life is hanging by a threat". They said that the farm leader is at the risk of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure as well.
Dallewal has been on a hunger strike at the Khanauri border between Punjab and Haryana since November 26, urging the central government to address the farmers' demands, including a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
Earlier on Thursday, the [Supreme Court expressed dissatisfaction with the Punjab government's efforts](https://www.indiatoday.in/india/law-news/story/supreme-court-raps-punjab-over-medical-care-for-fasting-farm-leader-jagjit-dallewal-2652501-2024-12-19) to provide adequate medical care for Dallewal. The court also urged the state to convince Dallewal, who is in his 70s, to shift to a hospital for proper treatment.
The police have converted a hotel near the protest site into a makeshift hospital to offer necessary medical services.
Addressing the media after examining Dallewal, Dr Navraj, who is associated with the Five Rivers NGO, said that Dallewal became unconscious as his blood pressure dropped due to his hunger strike. He was immediately given a massage and treatment, after which he regained consciousness, and is currently in a very critical condition.
Senior Medical Officer of Punjab's Samana, Dr Sanjeev Arora, said that Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health had deteriorated a lot during the day. A medical team from Rajinder Hospital Patiala has reached the spot and is conducting his health check-up, he said.

title: Daniel Ricciardo deja Visa Cash App RB con efecto inmediato
text: El anuncio se esperaba desde hace varias semanas y ya es oficial, el australiano Daniel Ricciardo no terminará la temporada 2024 al volante de la Visa Cash App RB, anunció este jueves la escudería italiana. El australiano, que regresó a la Fórmula 1 el año pasado procedente del Gran Premio de Hungría con el equipo AlphaTauri (ahora Visa Cash App RB), ha sumado puntos en cinco ocasiones esta temporada, pero sus actuaciones no serán suficientes para convencer al clan Red Bull. para conservarlo. El Gran Premio de Singapur del fin de semana pasado, donde finalizó 18º con la vuelta más rápida, fue, por tanto, su última carrera al volante de la Visa Cash App RB. Deja el equipo de Faenza con efecto inmediato. “TTodos en VCARB queremos agradecer a Daniel por su arduo trabajo durante las últimas dos temporadas con nosotros. » declaró Laurent Mekies, director del equipo Visa Cash App RB. “Aportó mucha experiencia y talento al equipo con una actitud fantástica, que ayudó a todos a desarrollar y fomentar un fuerte espíritu de equipo. » “Daniel era un verdadero caballero dentro y fuera de la pista y nunca dejaba de sonreír. Lo extrañaremos, pero siempre ocupará. un lugar especial dentro de la familia Red Bull. Tras este anuncio, el equipo confirmó la salida de Liam Lawson del Gran Premio de Estados Unidos de 2024 que se disputará en Austin a finales de octubre. “ También me gustaría aprovechar esta oportunidad para darle la bienvenida a Liam. Ya conoce bien al equipo. Condujo para nosotros la temporada pasada y manejó bien las circunstancias difíciles. » añadió Mekies. “Por tanto, será una transición natural. Es fantástico ver a los jóvenes talentos de la familia Red Bull dando el siguiente paso. Esperamos centrarnos juntos en el resto de la temporada. »

author: Express News Service
title: I’m committed to protecting Visakhapatnam Steel Plant: CM Naidu
text:
VISAKHAPATNAM: Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has asserted that he is committed to strengthening Visakhapatnam Steel Plant (VSP).
Speaking at Darlapudi in Anakapalle district after inspecting the Polavaram Left Canal works on Thursday, he said they have kept all options open to protect the steel plant. Without referring to the YSRC, Naidu said, “A political party is spreading canards that I have agreed to privatisation of the steel plant. VSP is a symbol of self-respect of Telugu people. We have fought against privatisation of the plant when such proposal was made earlier, and we also brought financial assistance from the Centre for the plant development. It is our responsibility to protect the plant.’’
Launching a tirade against the Opposition leaders, Naidu alleged that hardcore economic offenders had exploited Visakhapatnam, and such people would not be spared. “Three sugar factories in the cooperative sector have been closed down because of the inefficiency of the previous regime,” he observed.
On the irrigation sector, the Chief Minister asserted that every acre of land in North Coastal Andhra can be provided water if the Uttarandhra Sujala Sravanthi project is completed. In Anakapalle district alone, 2.80 lakh acres can be provided irrigation water, and the drinking water problem can also be resolved. The previous YSRC regime failed to take forward the Uttarandhra Sujala Sravanthi project, he deplored.
The Uttarandhra Sujala Sravanthi right canal works to the tune of 214 km need to be completed. In the first phase, `800 has to be spent on completing 93 km length of canal works to provide irrigation water to one lakh acres in Anakapalle district, Naidu said, and announced that tenders will be invited soon.
Later, Naidu inspected the progress of Bhogapuram Greenfield Airport in Vizianagaram district. He said the airport will play a major role in development of North Coastal Andhra, and the project will be completed by June 2026. “Bhogapuram will turn into a economic hub,” he averred.
Under Phase 1, a road will also be laid from Bhogapuram to Beach Road, another 50 km road connecting Srikakulam and the airport will be taken up in the second phase. Similarly, in the third phase, road connectivity will be provided to Mulapeta port, he explained.
“We are also planning to construct more airports in the State. The new airports have been proposed at Kuppam, Dagadarthi, Nagarjunasagar and Mulapet,” he revealed.

title: Barbara De Rossi hospitalized for an illness: "I feared to die"
text:
Actress Recovers After Sudden Illness Renowned actress Barbara De Rossi recently shared her harrowing experience with a sudden illness that required hospitalization.De Rossi, who was preparing for a television appearance, was unexpectedly struck by the illness, prompting an immediate call for medical assistance.
A Frightening Episode “I was afraid of dying,” De Rossi confessed, highlighting the severity of the situation. the actress’s experience underscores the unpredictable nature of health and the importance of immediate medical intervention when necessary. The prompt onset of her illness disrupted her professional commitments, forcing her to prioritize her well-being.
Hospitalization and Treatment De Rossi was promptly transported to the prestigious Gemelli Polyclinic in Rome, where a team of medical professionals conducted a series of tests to determine the cause of her sudden ailment. The actress spent several days under observation and care at the hospital, receiving comprehensive treatment and support from the dedicated medical staff.
“There were days of great concern,” De Rossi shared, emphasizing the emotional toll the experience took on her. Though, she also expressed deep gratitude for the extraordinary care she received, stating that the support provided was instrumental in her recovery.
A Glimmer of Hope Thankfully, De Rossi’s condition improved, allowing her to return home to loved ones. Relieved to be back on solid ground, she expressed a heartfelt “Now I’m fine,” publicly thanking the Gemelli medical team for their professionalism and her supporters for their unwavering encouragement.
De Rossi’s experience serves as a powerful reminder of the fragility of health and the importance of prioritizing one’s well-being. It also shines a light on the critical role healthcare professionals play in navigating health emergencies and providing compassionate care during challenging times.
How can we ensure that the level of care Barbara received at the Gemelli Polyclinic in Rome becomes a standard in healthcare settings worldwide?

title: chevron-right
text: WASHINGTON (TND) — The standoff at the Southern border is not letting up. Instead of allowing the federal government to cut through the razor wire in Eagle Pass, the state of Texas [is installing more.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iA1rEfMB5Q8) In [a statement](https://gov.texas.gov/uploads/files/press/Border_Statement_1.24.2024.pdf) released Wednesday, Governor Greg Abbott, R-Texas, declared, "The federal government has broken the compact between the United States and the states.” “The authors of the Constitution knew there would be times when the federal government would not live up to its duty so they empowered states in Article 1 Section 10 the right of self-defense," Abbott [told Fox News](https://www.foxnews.com/media/texas-gov-abbott-insists-courts-side-state-over-feds-border-battle-win) in an interview Thursday. He said he would press ahead, despite the U.S. Supreme Court [siding with the Biden Administration](https://www.npr.org/2024/01/22/1226142790/supreme-court-texas-razor-wire), which argued it has the federal authority to secure the border and to remove the razor wire as it sees fit, which the White House [argued is necessary.](https://www.wsj.com/us-news/law/supreme-court-lets-border-patrol-cut-razor-wire-texas-installed-to-stop-migrants-9c14b32f) It's unfortunate that there is a Governor in Texas, Governor Abbott, who has politicized this issue of what's happening on the border and it's not making people's lives safer. It's actually making it harder for law enforcement,at the border to do their job," White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said in an interview with CNN. This battle between state and federal government is unfolding as the federal government has been trying to take action, with bipartisan legislation in the Senate thought to be [close to completion, ](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2024/jan/25/trump-biden-israel-ukraine-funding-immigration-deal-latest)now facing [a major new hurdle, ](https://apnews.com/article/congress-border-security-ukraine-trump-a8601ec6629ddc5b769028ca99ad9879)with more and more Republicans publicly opposing it. In a news conference Wednesday, Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, said, "This supplemental bill is a kamikaze plane in a box canyon with no exits headed for a train wreck." Others blame an empowered Donald Trump for trying to tank the deal. The border is a very important issue for Donald Trump. And the fact that he would communicate to Republican Senators and Congress people that he doesn't want us to solve the border problem because he wants to blame Biden for it is is really appalling," Sen. Mitt Romney, R-Utah, said. As the drama deepens in Texas, there's more and more evidence of the impact nationwide. That includes more than 2,000 miles away at Boston’s Logan Airport where [more than a hundred migrants a](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DOwonr86bXw)re said to be taking shelter as other options and resources running out.

author: SPIE--International Society for Optics and Photonics
title: The Future of Renewable Energy: Transparent Spectral Converters Enhance Solar Cell Efficiency
text:
The protective material transforms harmful ultraviolet photons into visible light, increasing the conversion efficiency of photovoltaic devices.
Over the past decade, photovoltaic cells (PCs) have garnered much attention worldwide as promising sources of renewable energy. However, PCs still have not achieved light-to-electricity conversion efficiencies high enough to gain widespread adoption, and scientists are on the lookout for new materials and designs with better performance.
Limitations of Current Photovoltaic Technologies
Two of the most actively studied types of PCs are perovskite PCs and amorphous-silicon carbide (a-SiC:H) PCs, each with their own set of limitations. Perovskite PCs suffer from two major setbacks: first, even though solar radiation covers wavelengths that go from near-infrared all the way up to ultraviolet (UV) light, perovskite PCs use only a small portion of this spectrum, leading to low energy conversion efficiency. Second, they are vulnerable to photo-degradation from exposure to high-intensity UV light. In contrast, a-SiC:H PCs cannot effectively harvest UV light owing to a mismatch between the spectral profile of sunlight and the spectral response of a-SiC:H materials.
Innovative Spectral Converter Layer
But what if these problems could be solved simply by applying a special transparent layer on top of the PC? In a recent study published in the Journal of Photonics for Energy, a research team including Dr. Pei Song from Shanghai University of Engineering Science, China, developed a novel solar spectral converter using a GdPO4 glass-ceramic (GC) material doped with praseodymium (Pr) and europium (Eu) ions. This technology could lead to notable boosts in performance and applicability in solar cells.
Mechanism and Benefits of the New Converter Layer
The main purpose of GdPO4-GC:Eu3+/Pr3+ is to absorb UV photons from solar radiation and re-emit them as visible light. This is possible thanks to the efficient energy transfer that happens between the ions in the material. When a UV photon hits a Pr3+ ion, it generates an excited electronic state. This accumulated energy has a high chance of being transferred to a Gd3+ ion, which releases some of it before transferring the rest to an Eu3+ ion. As a result, excited electronic states in the Eu3+ ion undergo a down transition to lower energy states, emitting visible light.
Several experiments confirmed that the Gd3+ ions act as bridges between Pr3+ and Eu3+ ions in these energy transitions. Thus, a thin transparent GdPO4-GC:Eu3+/Pr3+ layer applied onto a PC not only shields it from UV photons but also feeds it additional light. Additionally, this protective effect helps prevent photo-degradation in perovskite PCs. Meanwhile, in both perovskite and a-SiC:H PCs, the spectral conversion layer helps the overall system use energy from solar radiation more efficiently by making it “sensitive” to UV photons, which would otherwise be wasted.
Potential Applications and Future Research
Notably, the proposed GdPO4-GC:Eu3+/Pr3+ material is straightforward to synthesize via a conventional melting quenching process. Moreover, since the material is also remarkably stable, it appears promising as a protective layer for space-borne PCs, such as those used in space stations. “Nowadays, expanding space stations require more power support and need high-performance PCs. By covering the top side of a PC with the proposed spectral conversion material and using appropriate encapsulation and sealing technology, we can ensure very low humidity levels and efficient UV recycling,” explains Song. “In addition, GC materials have a hard texture, so they can protect PCs from being hit by tiny floating debris in space.”
More studies will be needed to further improve the efficiency of PCs using doped GC materials as spectral converters. The researchers note that future work could focus on improving cost-effectiveness by adjusting doping concentrations and optimizing the thickness of the protective layer.
A Step Towards Sustainable Solar Energy
“With potential applications in both terrestrial and space PCs, the development of spectral downshifting Pr3+/Eu3+ co-doped glass-ceramics might open up new avenues to achieve better performance in photovoltaic devices,” concludes Song.
Let us hope that solar energy will grow to become not only an eco-friendly alternative to fossil fuels but also the energy source of the future!
Reference: “Ultraviolet-wavelength driven solar spectral converter for photovoltaic cell application” by Pei Song, Chaomin Zhang and Pengfei Zhu, 23 December 2023, Journal of Photonics for Energy.
DOI: 10.1117/1.JPE.14.015501

author: Rádio e Televisão de Portugal
title: Médicos Sem Fronteiras sobre ataques a alvos militares em Gaza. "Um hospital será sempre um hospital"
text:
Mundo | Guerra no Médio Oriente Médicos Sem Fronteiras sobre ataques a alvos militares em Gaza. "Um hospital será sempre um hospital" por RTP Quer partilhar este artigo? cancelar Foto: João Marques - RTP
João Antunes, gestor de operações dos Médicos Sem Fronteiras, denunciou um efeito "verdadeiramente apocalíptico" da guerra em Gaza e considerou que a população civil é a "principal perdedora" deste conflito.
VER MAIS Em entrevista à RTP3, criticou o uso de "armamento pesado" em zonas altamente povoadas e enfatizou que a organização Médicos Sem Fronteiras teve de retirar equipas de 14 estruturas de saúde por falta de condições de segurança.
Questionado sobre a presença de alvos militares em escolas ou hospitais, argumentou: "Uma escola será sempre uma escola, um hospital será sempre um hospital", alertando para as consequências diretas de bombardear este tipo de locais.
A decisão de continuar a bombardear locais com civis "ou é intencional ou é extrema negligência e incompetência", considerou.
Recorrendo ao histórico da Médicos Sem Fronteiras, João Antunes destacou o carácter inédito deste conflito, ao registar vários episódios num curto espaço de tempo em que a ajuda humanitária também foi um alvo.
Até ao momento já morreram seis médicos que trabalhavam para a MSF. A organização está agora em nove estruturas de saúde do enclave palestiniano. "Queríamos estar em muitas mais", assumiu o responsável.
Sobre a deterioração das condições humanitárias em Gaza, João Antunes destaca a eclosão de doenças como a polio, difteria ou o sarampo, mas também a desnutrição.
São as "mortes silenciosas" que não se contabilizam diretamente como vítimas deste conflito, frisou. PUB

author: Seapower Staff
title: Kratos & RAFAEL Establish Prometheus Energetics Joint Venture, a U.S.-Based Merchant Supplier of Solid Rocket Motors
text:
From Rafael Advanced Defense Systems Ltd.
SAN DIEGO, February 26, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) – Kratos Defense & Security Solutions, Inc. (Nasdaq: KTOS), a technology company in the defense, national security and global markets, and RAFAEL Advanced Defense Systems Ltd., today announced an approximate 50/50 partnership for the establishment of a U.S.-based merchant supplier of solid rocket motors (SRMs) and other energetics. The new joint venture, named Prometheus Energetics (“Prometheus”), is set to be headquartered on an approximate 500-acre site near the United States Navy and Army facility in Crane, Indiana.
Kratos and RAFAEL (through its U.S. based subsidiary RAFAEL USA) have jointly committed up to $175 million in capital for the establishment of Prometheus and required property, plant, equipment and personnel needed for the new, state-of-the-art energetics manufacturing campus and facilities. After construction of the plant and once RAFAEL’s technology transfer is completed and certified for operations, Prometheus is projected to begin production in 2027 of SRMs.
Eric DeMarco, President and CEO of Kratos Defense, said, “We believe Prometheus, once up and running at full rate production, will be a step function catalyst in value creation for Kratos’ stakeholders and the U.S. defense industrial base, similar to Kratos’ recent MACH-TB contract award—the largest single-award contract in Kratos history. Like other major Kratos investments such as Oriole, Zeus, and Erinyes, Prometheus responds to a critical need to strengthen the U.S. Industrial Base and will also provide tens of thousands of SRMs and casted warheads supporting both America’s most reliable partner in the Middle East and United States national security related demand from a true SRM and energetics merchant supplier.”
Yoav Tourgeman, President and CEO of RAFAEL Advanced Defense Systems Ltd., said:
“The establishment of Prometheus Energetics is a strategic leap forward, reinforcing RAFAEL’s commitment to strengthening the U.S. defense industrial base while ensuring our allies and partners have access to the most advanced, combat-proven energetics solutions. This step constitutes a strategic vector that combines business considerations in the American market with the increasing demand for energetic products, while significantly enhancing our ability to deliver resilient and reliable supply solutions to our customers. Through this joint venture, we are deepening our longstanding partnership with the United States, strengthening supply chain independence, and bolstering the critical capabilities needed to address evolving national security challenges.”

title: Every time country collapsed, UNP has saved it - Lasantha Gunawardena - DailyNews
text: United National Party’s (UNP’s) Colombo District Manager and Working Committee Member Lasantha Gunawardena said that every time the country collapsed, the UNP had had taken on the responsibility to save it and this time President Ranil Wickremesinghe would save the bankrupt country. Gunawardena said this while joining the press conference held on Wednesday (28) at Sirikotha, the UNP headquarters. He further expressed the following views: “When President Ranil Wickremesinghe took over the country in 2022, there was no money in the Treasury. There were long queues for petroleum and gas. Examinations could not be conducted. The farmers were destitute and they could not find a bundle of fertilizer even for Rs. 30,000. The dollar shot up to Rs. 400. Migrant workers did not send money to the country. No tourists came. The power cuts increased to 14 hours. It was a time when we had no way to pay for the oil tanker that anchored at the port. “Today, the Central Bank’s dollar reserves have been increased to US$ 4 billion. Today there are no gas queues, no oil queues. Schools are functioning on time and exams are being held. Children get more benefits including the Suraksha health insurance. Rs.113 billion was allocated from the Budget to increase salaries and pensions. Government employees’ allowances have been increased by Rs. 10,000. Also, the dollar, which was said to rise to Rs. 500, has been contained at Rs. 335 upper ceiling. “A sum of Rs. 207 billion was allocated for Aswesuma welfare benefits. A programme to grant land rights to people will begin in January. People get more value for their land accordingly. Urban residents are given ownership of their homes. It should be remembered that if the children had received tab computers, it would have been of great assistance during the Covid pandemic. “As a leader who thinks about the future, it should be noted that President Wickremesinghe’s allocation of money from this Budget for Artificial Intelligence is very important. Also, the bank interest which was 28 percent has been brought down to 12 percent. Through the Central Bank Act, a system has been created where money printing is limited. Inflation which was at 70 percent has been brought down to 3 percent.”
